metadata.title: CVE-2022-28284 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description: SVG's <use> element could have been used to loadunexpected content that could have executed script in certaincircumstances. While the specification seems to allow this, other browsersdo not, and web developers relied on this property for script security sogecko's implementation was aligned with theirs. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 99. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28284` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2 firefox-geckodriver - 99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2 firefox-mozsymbols - 99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
